title: It Just Won't CRUMBLE
body_text:
Factions WALL, ALL meet in Round 7!
No wonder this clash ever-so deservingly captured the prestigious 2007
RIVALRY of the Year
crown! Only a select few match-ups manage to produce such raw emotion and the desire to win as this year-long struggle. This seventh showing was no different than the rest - what an all-around memorable performance!
Flash Results by Game
ALL: 1, 2
WALL: 3, 4, 5, 6
The homeland defenders escaped with arguably their most impressive victory to date. Out-numbered like so many times before, members of this famed faction put their differences aside all in effort to halt such an invasion. Letsche and the Fitzpatrick brothers Eamon and Kevin, specifically, lead the force enduring all of the pain and punishment from the very beginning of the onslaught to the bitter, bitter end. And with that undying will and determination came their adversaries' reluctant decision to raise the white flag.
Team WALL 4, Team ALL 2.
The YEARBOOK
The seventh incarnation of Team ALL featured these fine athletes and their respective schools:
Manasquan
(Krott, Londono, Megill, Stopa)
; Red Bank Catholic
(D. Fitzpatrick, Mulligan, Zambito)
; Monmouth Regional
(Tronolone)
; Calvary Academy
(Smalls)
; Ocean Township
(Vetrano)
; Freehold Boro
(Pham)
; Allentown
(DiBuccio)
; Shore Regional
(Spengeman)
The Rules
: Classic two-team match-up.
The Match
: Team WALL defeated Team ALL, 4 - 2. This was the same score last time around as well
(see
DODGEBALL 135
)
.
Moments & Stars
: Kevin Fitzpatrick running down the Last Man Standing three-minute timer in both Games 1 and 2; Ryan Letsche angrily launching a team regeneration rim over the fence after receiving a stinging bulletball to back; Ryan Letsche, unbeknownst to his allies, flinging the rim back into the court; the hilarious Joey Smalls-deflection into teammate Diana DiBuccio
Attendance
: 23, comprised of 19 men and 4 women
New Players
: Andrew Mulligan
Other Notes
: Hometown heroes Team WALL remains atop the leader board in this series, winning their fifth contest out of the total seven.
________________________________________
_________________
Only THREE Left!
DODGEBALL 148 on 7.26.08
The highly-unpredictable
Player's Choice Rimshot Contest
makes its third appearance and to victor, the opportunity to run the show as he or she sees fit.
DODGEBALL 149 on 8.2.08
It won't matter how high they jump on this night, especially with a combined 14 losses. In a special
EastCoastDodgeball
presentation,
John Tronolone
goes one-on-one with
Derek Carty
. The loser will suffer his final defeat in this first-ever "Captains Retirement Match".
DODGEBALL 150 on 8.9.08 starting at 5pm
The single, biggest dodgeball attraction of the entire year and it only happens just this once.
EastCoastDodgeball's
ingenius "Writer" has taken six of the absolute best the game has to offer, divided them up into two separate entities, and forced them to wage war with each other. The deadly alliance of
Lauren Stopa
,
Tom Adams
, and
Diana DiBuccio
must contend with an equally destructive trio in
Bobby Vetrano
,
Alison Bertsch
, and
Juan Londono
. Missing out on this once-in-a-lifetime event would be a sin.
Get all the up-to-date news right here on
dodgeball.livejournal.com
. And for those of you on the ECD TextMessagingList, make sure you check those phones!
body_html:
Factions WALL, ALL meet in Round 7!
No wonder this clash ever-so deservingly captured the prestigious 2007 RIVALRY of the Year crown! Only a select few match-ups manage to produce such raw emotion and the desire to win as this year-long struggle. This seventh showing was no different than the rest - what an all-around memorable performance!

Flash Results by Game
ALL: 1, 2
WALL: 3, 4, 5, 6

The homeland defenders escaped with arguably their most impressive victory to date. Out-numbered like so many times before, members of this famed faction put their differences aside all in effort to halt such an invasion. Letsche and the Fitzpatrick brothers Eamon and Kevin, specifically, lead the force enduring all of the pain and punishment from the very beginning of the onslaught to the bitter, bitter end. And with that undying will and determination came their adversaries' reluctant decision to raise the white flag.

Team WALL 4, Team ALL 2.

The YEARBOOK
The seventh incarnation of Team ALL featured these fine athletes and their respective schools:
Manasquan (Krott, Londono, Megill, Stopa); Red Bank Catholic (D. Fitzpatrick, Mulligan, Zambito); Monmouth Regional (Tronolone); Calvary Academy (Smalls); Ocean Township (Vetrano); Freehold Boro (Pham); Allentown (DiBuccio); Shore Regional (Spengeman)

The Rules: Classic two-team match-up.
The Match: Team WALL defeated Team ALL, 4 - 2. This was the same score last time around as well (see DODGEBALL 135).
Moments & Stars: Kevin Fitzpatrick running down the Last Man Standing three-minute timer in both Games 1 and 2; Ryan Letsche angrily launching a team regeneration rim over the fence after receiving a stinging bulletball to back; Ryan Letsche, unbeknownst to his allies, flinging the rim back into the court; the hilarious Joey Smalls-deflection into teammate Diana DiBuccio
Attendance: 23, comprised of 19 men and 4 women
New Players: Andrew Mulligan
Other Notes: Hometown heroes Team WALL remains atop the leader board in this series, winning their fifth contest out of the total seven.






_________________________________________________________





Only THREE Left!

DODGEBALL 148 on 7.26.08
The highly-unpredictable Player's Choice Rimshot Contest makes its third appearance and to victor, the opportunity to run the show as he or she sees fit.

DODGEBALL 149 on 8.2.08
It won't matter how high they jump on this night, especially with a combined 14 losses. In a special EastCoastDodgeball presentation, John Tronolone goes one-on-one with Derek Carty. The loser will suffer his final defeat in this first-ever "Captains Retirement Match".

DODGEBALL 150 on 8.9.08 starting at 5pm
The single, biggest dodgeball attraction of the entire year and it only happens just this once.

EastCoastDodgeball's ingenius "Writer" has taken six of the absolute best the game has to offer, divided them up into two separate entities, and forced them to wage war with each other. The deadly alliance of Lauren Stopa, Tom Adams, and Diana DiBuccio must contend with an equally destructive trio in Bobby Vetrano, Alison Bertsch, and Juan Londono. Missing out on this once-in-a-lifetime event would be a sin.

Get all the up-to-date news right here on dodgeball.livejournal.com. And for those of you on the ECD TextMessagingList, make sure you check those phones!
